p.seg: Mr. Stevens said he had drawn the attention of Baron Von Mueller to a beautiful light purple fungus which had been found on the slopes of Mount Wellington. The fungus being too fragile to bring into town, a drawing made by Miss Walker, of Rhodes, N. S. W., had been forwarded to the Baron who had identified it as a species of
and had since sent the following note on the subject:
I sent the drawing to the great specialist, Dr. Cooke, pointing out that the fungus was near
but differed somewhat in colour, and suggested the name
. He, however, regards it as the real species of Fries.

It is new to Tasmania, indeed to Australia, so perhaps it is worthy of notice at your Royal Society, if it was only to show that fungi need yet much to be studied there.
